email.title: Weekly Digest
email.text:
Hi everyone, hope you've had a great week!
In this week's digest you can find out more about: * joining the DoCSoc committee, * Imperial Young Professionals' mentorship programme, * LGBT+ Careers Panel * and Jane Street Insight Programmes!
email.heading: IYP Tech Mentorship Program
email.text:
The Imperial Young Professionals network have reached out to us to announce that applications are open for their IYP Tech Mentorship Program!
The mentorship program will connect you with current Imperial alumni working in software engineering, data science, machine learning and even less technical areas such as, business analysts, business development, product managers, project manager etc...
The aim of the program is to help Imperial students get an inside look into Tech careers and maximise their chances of landing that dream job.
The program will run officially through March and April in which time you will meet individually with your mentors as well as take part in kick off and round-off events to get to know other participants.
Sound like something you’re interested in?
[Apply](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/124Rlq9IlGwgCHs1aqPdBuCW20jBG4aBESmmgatt889o/viewform) before Friday 26th February.
## What is IYP Tech?
IYP Tech is a program which aims to cultivate a community of Imperial Alumni working in Tech and connect them to Imperial students, increasing their exposure to various career paths. The IYP Tech program includes a series of webinars & panels as well as a mentorship program to increase your understanding of what a career in Tech could look like and connect you with current alumni working in the field.
email.heading: LGBT+ Careers Panel
email.text:
Tuesday 23 February 18:30 – 20:00 (GMT)
February is [LGBT History Month](https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/campaigns/lgbt-history-month-2021) in the UK and as part of our events we’re hosting an LGBT+ Careers Panel in partnerships with [IQ, (LGBT+ Student Society)](https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/activities/a-to-z/iq-imperial-college-lgbt) on 23 February from 18:30 – 20:00 GMT. The careers panel will include conversations with LGBT+ employees from various organisations including AstraZeneca, Arup, Accenture, FTI Consulting and Enterprise. We’ll hear about their careers and explore that it’s possible to be comfortable and successful at work while being yourself regardless of sexual orientation or the gender identity.
Any student who identifies as LGBT+ or who is an ally of the community is welcome to attend. You can find out more and [book a ticket through Eventbrite](https://imperialcollegelondon-lgbtcareerspanel2021.eventbrite.co.uk/). You’re welcome to register and access the event using a personal email address if you’d like anonymity.
email.heading: So you want to run for DoCSoc?

event.text:
So you want to run for DoCSoc? Not sure about which role to run? Have questions you want to ask with the current committee members?
Join us virtually to learn more before you make your decision to stand for a DoCSoc Committee position!

email.heading: Jane Street Programmes
email.sponsor:
![Discover](https://i.imgur.com/wfYPx6Z.png)
Discover is a one day Insight-style programme hosted by Jane Street for students at any point in their university studies. This is an opportunity to learn how math, computer science, and probability concepts have a real-world impact on the work we do. Participants will hear from traders and technologists to learn how they apply their STEM backgrounds in their day to day work at Jane Street. The next Discover session will run on Wednesday, 10 March, 2021.
Jane Street is a quantitative trading firm that uses innovative technology, a scientific approach, and a deep understanding of markets to guide our business. Founded in 2000, Jane Street employs more than 1,300 people with offices in New York, London, Amsterdam, and Hong Kong. We are always on the lookout for great new people to join our team.
The environment at Jane Street is open, informal, intellectual, and fun. The dress code is casual, the kitchen is stocked, and discussions are always lively. Teaching and learning are central activities through classes, mentoring, and discussion.
There is no prior knowledge of finance required for this programme — just intellectual curiosity and a genuine interest in what a career at Jane Street might look like. While this session is virtual, it is intended for students currently located in Europe. Interested students can apply below. We look forward to meeting you soon!
[Apply](https://www.janestreet.com/apply-discover?utm_source=email&utm_campaign=discover)
**The deadline to apply is Thursday, 4th March, 11:59pm GMT.**
![Insight](https://i.imgur.com/IbxUepZ.png)
This April 7th-9th, Jane Street is excited to host our INSIGHT programme for students across Europe. We’re inviting self-identifying women and gender expansive people to spend three days learning more about what we do and how we do it through a set of trading and programming classes and activities. Attendees will receive an in-depth look into the ways we use maths and computer science, as well as insight into the different roles that exist within our firm. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the program will be remote this year.
In the trading program, students will learn about mathematical and financial topics such as probability, market structure, and arbitrage through a combination of short lectures, group games, and mock trading sessions. These activities are structured to provide a foundation for and a broad overview of our work, and there will be plenty of opportunities for close interaction with our traders.
Students selected for the software engineering program will receive an in-depth look into the ways we use computer science within our firm. They will learn OCaml, and the libraries and tools we use in our daily work, and how to put them to use by building a computer game. Participants will also learn the fundamentals of electronic trading systems.
Jane Street is a quantitative trading firm that uses innovative technology, a scientific approach, and a deep understanding of markets to guide our business. We are a global liquidity provider and market maker. With offices in New York, London, Hong Kong and Amsterdam, we operate around the clock and around the globe.
Founded in 2000, Jane Street employs over 1300 people. We are always recruiting top students and the environment at Jane Street is open, informal, intellectual and fun. The dress code is casual and discussions are always lively. Teaching and learning are central activities through classes, mentoring and discussion.
Apply here to be considered for a spot in the program.
[Apply](https://www.janestreet.com/apply-insight-ldn?utm_source=email&utm_campaign=insight)
After the application deadline, selected applicants will receive an invitation to complete a puzzle or coding challenge based on which group you applied for.
**The deadline to apply for this event is 14th March, 11:59pm GMT.** If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to email JSINSIGHT@janestreet.com.
Good luck with the application process and we hope to meet you soon!
![In Focus](https://i.imgur.com/khFAOX4.png)
This April 14th-16th, Jane Street is excited to host our IN FOCUS event for students in Europe. We're inviting students to spend three days learning more about what we do and how we do it through mentorship, programming, mock trading, classroom lectures, and activities. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the program will be remote this year.
This program is for undergraduate students, inclusive of first year and penultimate year students, who self-identify with a historically underrepresented minority group. It does not require a prior knowledge of finance, only an interest in seeing what a career in finance and at Jane Street might look like.
Attendees participating in the software development program will receive an in-depth look into the ways we use computer science within our firm. They will learn OCaml, and the libraries and tools we use in our daily work, and how to put them to use by building a computer game. Participants will also learn the fundamentals of electronic trading systems and write a program that trades on a simulated stock exchange.
Attendees participating in the trading program will learn about mathematical and financial topics such as probability, market structure, and arbitrage through a combination of short classroom lectures, group games, and mock trading sessions. These activities are structured to provide a foundation for and a broad overview of our work, and there will be plenty of opportunities for close interaction with our traders.
Apply here to be considered for a spot in the program.
[Apply](https://www.janestreet.com/apply-in-focus-ldn)
After the application deadline, selected applicants will receive an invitation to complete a puzzle or coding challenge based on which group you applied for.
**The deadline to apply for this event is 14th March @ 11:59pm GMT**. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to email FOCUS@janestreet.com.
